title-group.article-title: MIDPOINT CRITERIA FOR SOLVING PELL'S EQUATION USING THE NEAREST SQUARE CONTINUED FRACTION

abstract.p: We derive midpoint criteria for solving Pell's equation x² - Dy² = ±1, using the nearest square continued fraction expansion of $\sqrt D $ . The period of the expansion is on average 70% that of the regular continued fraction. We derive similar criteria for the diophantine equation $x^2 \, - \,xy\, - \,\frac{{(D - 1)}}{4}y^2 \, = \, \pm 1$ , where D = 1 (mod 4). We also present some numerical results and conclude with a comparison of the computational performance of the regular, nearest square and nearest integer continued fraction algorithms.
